title: Ondansetron for intravenous use: clarification of advice on new posology in patients age 65 years or older
raw_html:
Ondansetron for intravenous use: clarification of advice on new posology in patients age 65 years or older

Article date: August 2013

We would like to make you aware that on July 24, 2013 we updated the information in the recent intravenous ondansetron posology article published in the July 2013 issue of the bulletin. The article was updated to clarify that the new advice on dilution and administration in patients age 65 years or older refers only to the indication for prevention of chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting; there has been no change to the dosing, dilution, or administration instructions for the indication of postoperative nausea and vomiting.

The article can be found here. If you read, downloaded, or shared the article before the update on July 24, 2013, please revisit the article to ensure that you have the most up to date information.

 

Article citation: Drug Safety Update vol 7 issue 1, August 2013: O3.
